text: Where the THREE MOST IMPORTANT PEOPLE IN THE WORLD float mid-air, gravely looking at the image before them. Super: San Dimas, California, 2713. They turn to a FOURTH MAN - very severe, almost puritanic looking, dressed in all black (ROLLINS).

Their time is running out. We must take emergency measures. The future of everything hangs in the balance. On Rollins’ face, a slight flash of concern - and surpris He steps into a SLEEK, SILVER METALLIC BOOTH.. dons his SUNGLASSES. And, with a nod to the Great Ones..  The booth shimmers, drops through the floor. Cut to BLACK. Title up: BILL AND TED FACE THE MUSIC Then fade up on:

Bill and Ted, in their mid-40’s, in suits, walk up to a microphone. Behind them, a banner reads “CONGRATULATIONS DEACON AND MISSY.” We are at a wedding. Garden-variety, middle class Joanna and Elizabeth are there (also in their mid 40's). Elizabeth is with WILL (18); Joanna is with THEO (also 18 The guys are buoyant, exuberant-- utterly unflappable.
Good afternoon. And welcome to this joyous occasion.
Ted and I have both known Missy in different capacities for nearly 40 years.
She was Bill’s babysitter when we were ten, and we both invited her to the prom when she was a senior and we were freshman.
Next she married my dad, and Missy became “Mom.”

After quickly divorcing Bill’s dad, Missy married my dad, and became my mom. Ted's dad, POLICE CHIEF CHET LOGAN, now in his mid 60’s a still very fit, raises his glass with a tight smile that barely masks his bitterness.
And now she is marrying Ted’s younger brother, Officer Deacon Logan. We see DEACON now, 40, buzz cut, with MISSY, now late 40' He raises his glass.
Deacon - my congratulations. Missy - Bill and I - along with Joanna and Elizabeth, and Will and Theo - welcome you back with open arms. Elizabeth, Joanna, Will and Theo all raise glasses.
This joyous event would seem to make Deacon his own father-in-law, and make Ted his own uncle.
Not to mention making my dad his own son. In back, Logan just shakes his head, irked on so many lev
So with that beautiful thought in mind, for your first dance, we wish to present a sneak peek at the world premiere of our newest sonic creation..
So please enjoy the first three movements of..
“That Which Binds Us Through Time: The Chemical, Physical and Biological Nature of Love; An Exploration of the Meaning of Meaning.”
Ready, Bill?
Ready, Ted. One..
Two..

One two three four.. Ted plays bagpipes. Bill is engaged in a kind of wide- mouthed Aboriginal ‘throat-singing.’ While clearly a grea deal of of this and, in Wedding thought (and even love) has gone into the preparation piece, it is at its core quite difficult to define fact, impossible to enjoy. guests watch with jaw-dropped befuddlement as -  9. Deacon and Missy step to the dance floor - aware that thi somehow their “first dance.” But it’s hard for them to decipher how, exactly, they’re supposed to move to this. Joanna and Elizabeth exchange a glance. As do Will and Th Ted’s dad just openly throws his hands up..
This is bullshit. .»-and crosses to a power bank and literally pulls the pl the whole thing. CUT TO:
Ted and his dad, off to the side of the stage.
I’m sorry you don’t get it, Dad.
No one gets it, Ted. No one ever has. There’s nothing to get.
They will, Dad, seriously.

I don’t think so. That song is the worst one yet. And that’s saying a lot. I told Deacon he should never have let you guys play. I’m sorry, “play.” And honestly - on a very deep level - it is time to pull the plug. Both of you.
We can’t. We have to pursue this until --
Yeah yeah yeah, I know, until your “music saves the world.” Ted. Enough with your delusions. While this continues we CUT AWAY TO:
Where Bill wheels equipment to the back door. He pulls it open and sees - his FATHER, BOB PRESTON, slumped in the b having just been awakened.
Hey dad.  10.
How was the wedding?
It was good. You shoulda come in.
Weddings are hard for me, Billy. My social worker says I’ve never really recovered from your mom leaving all those years ago. Your real mom, not Missy.
I know. That was hard. Mr. Preston gives Bill a huge hug.
I love you, Billy.

I know, Dad. And I love you, too. (as his dad continues to hug him) Okay, Dad. It’s totally fine. Everything's good, Dad. Everything’s gonna be okay. I really gotta go get some more stuff. He breaks off, turns. And we follow him to --
Still in the thick of it.
Dad - I’m just saying: if you’d done the things me and Bill have done, and seen the things we've seen --
No - you can keep “spinning” this however you want, Ted, but I’1l never believe it. You didn’t time travel. You didn’t die and go to hell and then come back.
Chief Logan - we did -
No. You didn’t, Bill. And here’s the reason you didn’t: it’s impossible.
Dad - I know you’re upset because Deacon just married --  11.
No. Ted - you’re wrong. It has nothing to do with that. Trust me, if I’m more disappointed in one of my sons, it’s you. Logan spins to storm away. Then turns back.
By the way? That five thousand dollars I loaned you? I want it back.
You'll get it back.

When, Ted? You’re upside down on your mortgage. You’re fifty thousand dollars in debt. Your wife is working two jobs so you two can pursue your pathetic fantasy. Get real, Ted. Get real - both of you. And he’s off. Ted just stands there. Bill puts his hand o Ted’s shoulder.
Dude - if it’s any consolation, I’m eighty- thousand dollars in debt.
What are we gonna do? MAN’S VOICE (PRELAP) No. No, no, no.
Keys and coat in hand, the stadium manager (FRANK) closes office door as Bill and Ted follow him out into the arena
No, you may not have your non-refundable deposit back.
But --
No ‘buts.’ Twenty years ago you signed a contract - put down a deposit - to rent the Forum tomorrow night for your concert celebrating “Two Decades of Greatness--”
Triumphance.  12.
Whatever. I tell you this every year--
But this year is different.
It’s quite different - as you will see if you'd simply listen to us.
Fine. Go ahead.
This year, given the direness of our financial situation, we’re willing to reduce our offer from a one hundred percent refund to an eighty percent refund.
So wait - I’m sorry - then I’d only have to give you eighty thousand dollars that I contractually do not owe you rather than a hundred thousand?
Correct. But between us, our bottom line is sixty thousand, for which we will take forty.
But no lower than twenty-five.
Of which we would accept ten. Ted leans to Bill.
Dude - I have a sneaking feeling that we're negotiating against ourselves.
Good point, Ted. (turns ) Forget everything we said. We’re back at a hundred thousand. Plus interest.

Okay, then I guess I should make my counter offer: nothing. The point is: you bought the Forum tomorrow night - it’s yours. Do whatever you want with it - throw a party at mid-field, I don’t care. The lights’ll be on, the gate’1ll be open. (MORE )
By the way - just out of curiosity - how many tickets have you guys sold?
Well, it’s hard to say - it could have changed, cause we haven’t checked the web site in a while.
That's fine. Just give me the ballpark number.
Okay - ballpark? I’m just estimating here, but approximately zero. Frank shakes his head.
I have to tell you guys - what you have pulled off here is very impressive, ina way. You’ve promoted a concert for twenty years, and sold zero tickets.
Thanks, dude.
It’s not a compliment.
Bill and Joanna ride up in silence. They get off and ente
And Joanna stops as she sees: Elizabeth and Ted, also in waiting room. Elizabeth is equally surprised. Ted is not.
How’s it goin’ dude? Hey, Jo!
I’m sorry - is this the right day?
Yah. Totally. Couples therapy.

But.. Now the other door opens and the THERAPIST sticks his hea out - a bit surprised to see TWO couples in his waiting r  14. INT. THERAPIST’S OFFICE - A MOMENT LATER Bill, with Joanna, and Ted, with Elizabeth, sit across fr the Therapist. It’s a little crowded on the couch.
So do you understand why this situation might seem at all strange to your wives?
No, not at all. Why?
Well, when your wives suggested couples therapy, did you think this is what they had in mind?
Yah. Definitely. I mean, we’re a couple of couples, right?
Well, it usually means one couple.
Ohhh..
But since you’re here - let me ask you this. Is there something you feel your wives need to hear from you?
Yah. Totally. (turning to Elizabeth) We love you guys.
Okay, that’s good. But.. Do you understand how that might sound strange to your wives? Bill?
No. We love em.
“We” love them?
Yah, we do.
“We" do?
Yah, we do. Exactly.  15.
It’s the “we” part.. Ted. Can you say the same thing using “I” in the sentence?
Ohhh. Yah, of course. (turns to Elizabeth) Elizabeth. I - and Bill - love you - and Joanna. Elizabeth just stares at the floor, shakes her head.
Dude. All due respect - I don’t think you're getting this.
Go for it, dude.
Okay. (turns ) Joanna. From the very very bottom of I - and Ted’s - hearts. I - and Ted - totally love and worship you - and Elizabeth. Bill beams. Ted nods - as if he now sees.
Joanna, would you or Elizabeth like to respond? Elizabeth indicates “go ahead.”

Well.. Okay. I know you love me, Bill. However - and I can’t speak for Elizabeth, but.. you guys are gone over two hundred nights a year. Every time you go out on tour to make money, you come back deeper in debt.
But we have to --
I know. I know it’s a burden for you. And I know you feel as though you have to do it yourselves. But you don’t. We literally left everything behind, our families, our friends..
We moved 600 years in the future to be with you. To be your partners. But it’s like all you think about is the song..  16.
The mission..
And it’s like we and the boys are not even there.
So.. Wait. What are you saying?
I guess what I’m saying is.. If things don’t change.. I don’t know how much longer I can go on like this. Ted is stunned. He looks at Bill. Bill turns to Joanna.
Do you feel the same way? Joanna nods.
Ted and Elizabeth, in tense silence. Ted glances over - s just stares straight ahead. They pull up to the end of --

Where TWO HOUSES share a driveway at the end of a quiet middle-class street. As they pull in -- A GEO METRO is already there, and Bill and Joanna are get out - also with palpable tension between them. (What is clear to us now is: they all live right next doo to each other, and share a driveway - and garage.) As the women head towards the Logan house, Bill and Ted j each other.
Dude - things are worse than I thought. I think they're actually thinking about leaving us.
I know, it’s bad. But we still got our work to do.. They look at their wives, who are conferring at the front door.  17.
Okay - let’s just try and work sorta fast.
Yah. Totally. As they start toward the GARAGE-- suddenly we HEAR the so of GUITARS from within. Ted exhales heavily.
I’ve told Will over and over.. They pull the garage door open, revealing:
Will and Theo are playing classic old guitars (the very o that Bill and Ted played at the end of “Bogus Journey."”) They immediately stop, look at their fathers.
How’s it goin, dad?
Out!
What?
This is our studio - and those are our guitars. He and Bill pull the guitars from their sons’ hands.
We have important work to do, and we can’t have you messing around in here.
You wanna at least see what we’ve been working on? Will holds a piece of paper out. Ted takes it, shoves it his pocket.
Later. But right now, we need the studio. (a beat) Now, please, Will.
Okay, Grampa.  18. The boys shake their heads.

I told you, dude. It’s always the same. Let’s just go play up in my room. With our crappy guitars. Will nods and the boys head out. Bill and Ted watch them guilty, as Ted shuts the garage door and we cut to:
Bill and Ted are working on a song; struggling. Bill is noodling on the synthesizer - Ted is scratching out lyric
Okay, I added a couple things. Go again. Bill starts on the synthesizer: it’s abstruse, complex (n in a good way) - like D-grade Bohemian Rhapsody.
“We try - y - y - y to carry--yy.. on. Ayiii-eee-ee-ee-ee. .a-000-00-00-00.” Ted stops. Bill picks it up.
“OQoEEEE-eeee-YIYIYIYI..” (to Ted) Dude - run with me. I think we’re onto something... (resuming) “We straaa—aaaa-aaa-aaa-aain..yiyi-yi-yi-- ”
Dude - seriously. Stop. I hate to say this, but we’re NOT onto anything.
What are you talking about? I think it’s our best one yet.
Dude - if that’s true - then things are even worse than I thought. Cause this song sucks. You do know that, right?
I don’t agree.
Dude.  19.
No.

Bill - come on. It’s me. You don’t have to spin me. It sucks. All our songs suck. What are we doing? Seriously. Our wives are mad at us, our sons are mad at us, we're broke-- why are we even doing this?
We're doing it cause we have to! Ted - we're supposed to save all humanity.
Says who??
Those people - from the future --
What if they were wrong?
How could they be wrong? We saw the future - we were there.
Alls I know is, at this moment, I feel like for the last 20 years we've been beating our heads against a wall, and it hurts, and I wanna stop.
But we can’t! We promised!
Who’s gonna care? Seriously. I’m sick of it. And you know you are too. Bill just looks at Ted - for a long moment - and then he deflates, dropping the facade.
Okay. Yah. I’m totally sick of it. But I thought if I ever admitted it - to you or me - we’d completely crumble. There’s a pause.

I can’t do this any more. I just can’t. Another pause. Finally Bill looks at Ted.. And nods, agreeing. Then, suddenly, there’s --  20. A FLASH of LIGHT outside, visible under the garage door.. Then: We HEAR a metallic WHOOSH.. Then FOOTSTEPS. Someone Or something.. is outside. Bill and Ted look at each other, walk toward the garage d and slowly open it, revealing-- The futuristic BOOTH.
Whoa.. And next to the booth, emerging from its shadow, ROLLINS.
Who are you?
Come with me, please.
Are you from the future?
Yes. A beat. The guys look at each other again.
Are you mad at us?
We have very little time. He opens the door for them. Ted leans closer to Bill.
I think we’re in trouble.
Relax, Ted. They totally love us in the future. The guys get into the sleek, elegant booth. Rollins close the door, and in an instant.. It shimmers.. and DISAPPEAR
Dark. Misty. Glimpses of light. We hear a WHOOOSH and the silver booth soars past in blur.  21.
Bill and Ted - stunned, amazed - gape out at the circuits time.. for the first time in a long time. And we cut to:
The booth appears and touches down on the floor. Rollins gets out, followed by Bill and Ted. Bill and Ted whisper:
Dude.
What?
I think I liked Rufus better.
Me too. (turns to Rollins) What is it you do here, dude?
I clean up messes. The guys look at each other as they hear..

Bill and Ted. Step closer please. Now they turn and see: THREE IMPOSING FIGURES-- who look at Bill and Ted with ba restrained urgency and frustration. They are fierce, unblinking. It’s dark and intense. Bill and Ted look at each other, swallow. Around the room is a kind of “Senate” of observers who li the walls. Bill adopts an upbeat manner.
How’s it goin’? Good to be back again. Lookin’ great.
What do you have to say for yourselves?
Oh.. They look at each other, then adopt their arm-raised post  22.
Be excellent to each other..?
And.. party on, dudes..? Dead silence. No smiles. No nods. Nothing but scowls.
Where's the song? The guys eyes widen..
Oh.. The song.
Which one? We've written so many.
The song. The song that will fulfill your destiny. The one that is to be played at the Fabulous Forum tomorrow night. The one that will save the world as we know it.
Oh, yah. That song. We definitely have that song. Yah. The Leader makes a gesture. Lights come up and suddenly a around them are MUSICAL INSTRUMENTS of all shapes and siz
Then play it.
Like right now?
We need to hear it.
Um.. Before we do that --
Which we very much look forward to doing --
And are most eminently prepared to do --
Being as it’s already written --  A pause. 23.
And is very good on the level of lyrics, and melody, and rhythmic aspects as well as meter and, you know, thematic content.. we need to..
Tweak..
Yah. MTweak..
Or, even better, perhaps what would expedite this entire process..
Would be if you played the song for us right now.
Or perhaps played it several times.
Or even just give us a recording. So we may be certain we have the exact rendition of our greatest song ever written..
You don’t have it.
What?! No. Just the opposite.
In fact, our problem is we have so many great songs that as we put together our set list for the concert tomorrow night --
The one we in no way bailed on years ago --
And which as recently as an hour ago did not try to get our money back from -
Right, that did not happen..

You're not watching us all the time, are you?  24. Silence. Then the Leader just waves his arms and THE FLOATING GREAT FIGURES DISAPPEAR INTO DARKNESS -- as do t instruments, and instantly-- Rollins is standing right in front of the guys.
The window of destiny is closing. You have twenty four hours to come up with the song.
But-- What if for some reason we don’t?
Which would be most paradoxical because obviously we do already have it.
But, you know, just theoretically.. cause we are intrigued with all manner of thought experiment involving, you know, “the conundrum of time”..
So-- What would happen? Rollins looks at them.
Come with me. He turns. The guys look at each other, then follow him as two huge doors slide open and they all enter --
Built solely to house:
Ethereal, majestic, floating in mid-air. Weaving and wind from the deepest past all the way to the present - and, still, moment by moment, continuing to inch forward.
Whoa...
What is this?

This is time. It’s the path through which the past connects with the present.. and leads to the future.  25. The guys move closer. Now they can see that the “weave” i actually a collection of INFINITESIMALLY SMALL BITS OF INFORMATION. Rollins reaches out and TOUCHES a section, in the way one might touch, say, an iPad. As he does.. ROLLINS (CONT’D) 1945. --an IMAGE FROM 1945 balloons out: Hiroshima. He removes his finger - the image recedes. He touches another spot.. ROLLINS (CONT’D) 1989. .--and out balloons an image of the Man standing in front the tank in Tiananmen Square. ROLLINS (CONT’D) Time is more fluid, and more contingent, than you understand. There are key moments in the weave - turning points - like stitches, if you want to think of them that way. And when one is missing, then everything can fray.
Has that ever happened?
It’s about to happen.
Meaning..?
If you don’t have the song in 24 hours, time as we all know it will essentially unravel. Forward, and backward.
Oh...
The booth appears. The guys get out, still in shock. Rollins gives Ted a TIMEPIECE of some sort.. like a reall cool, sleek WATCH.
Keep a close eye on this. You have 24 hours. When it runs out, it’s over.  26. Rollins crosses back to his booth and gets in.. And, with nod at them, he’s gone.
Okay - bad news: the whole unraveling of time thing could be most heinous. Good news: This means there is a song. Otherwise they wouldn’t be so mad at us for not having it.
--Yah. I think that’s probably right.
So now, alls we gotta do is stop writing songs that totally suck, and just write the greatest song ever written. Okay?
.-Yah.. I guess. Bill starts into the garage. Ted remains on the curb.
Ted, what are you doing, dude? We gotta keep going.
I just don’t get it.. I mean-- We’ve been trying for 20 years to write the greatest song ever written. How are we gonna do it in 24 hours?
I don’t know.. But we gotta. (beat) I mean.. Right? What else are we gonna do, dude? Ted nods - distant and distracted.
But we do know the song’s gonna exist, right?
Well, yah.. at some point..
I just wish there was a way that we could go into the future and get it from ourselves.
How would we do that?  27. There’s a pause. They look at each other, sharing a slowl dawning realization.
Could we actually...?
Couldn't we..?
But-- didn’t Rufus say we could only do that in an extreme emergency?

Bill-- if the future of all of reality as we know it is at stake.. isn’t that an extreme emergency? EXT. BILL’S HOUSE - NIGHT - MOMENT LATER The guys head towards a STORAGE SHED at the very back of property. At the shed, they undo a series of heavy metal padlocks. The door opens.. a single light bulb is switched on..

The guys walk to the darkest, most shadowy corner and sta to pull a series of covers, sheets, tarps, etc., off of w gradually reveals itself as.. THE PHONE BOOTH.. The old one from the earlier movies. It’s dusty, rusted, obviously hasn’t been used in 20 year
Okay, so here’s the plan: We go into the future to when we've actually written the song, find ourselves, and take it.
One question: Is that stealing?
Why would it be stealing if we’re getting it from ourselves?
Oh, yah.. (eyeing the booth) You think it still works?  28.
Only one way to find out, dude..
They get in. Dust off the key pad.
How far into the future do you think we need to go?
Depends on when we think we’re gonna write the song.
I say definitely within the next year or two.
Well, let’s be conservative. Say five years?
Sounds good. (a pause) You wanna do the honors, or should I?
Go for it, dude. Ted - with not a little bit of nostalgia and a good deal trepidation.. starts to hit the buttons.

San Dimas, California.. Five years from now. At first, nothing happens. It’s like starting a car that’ been sitting in the garage for 20 years. Then-- the light in the booth flicker on... there is a low humming/buzzing sound. As the antenna comes to life, illuminating the dar shed, the guys look at each other.
Bill..
What?
I have a feeling things are just about to change in a most outstanding way.  29.
Ted, I totally agree. And with an exuberant, super-optimistic AIR GUITAR..
Let’s go save the world, dude! ..the booth shimmers and DISAPPEARS and we cut to:

Whhhoooshhhhhh. The booth sails through the circuits of t which are sleeker, faster than when last we sailed throug The guys look through the glass - thrilled, moved: neithe thought he'd ever be doing this again.
Whoa...
I know.. The booth veers off, disappears into a circuit and we cut

On the marquee: “OPEN MIC NIGHT.” We hear a faint version of Huey Lewis’ “The Heart of Rock'n Roll” coming from ins a sad version - kind of pathetic; earnest and overly sinc Super: San Dimas, California - five years into the future The booth APPEARS lands in the parking lot. The guys step out, look around - hear the music from within..
They enter the lobby.
So where are the future us’s?
Yah - you'd think we’d be waiting for ourselves.
We gotta remember to be more polite and come out and greet ourselves next time. (notices something) Oh no..  30. Bill turns - follows Ted’s gaze into --
Where ON STAGE - in front of a dozen bored businessmen -

In black vests, white shirts, earrings - singing “Heart o Rock'n Roll.” 50 Yr Old Bill is working a little harder t push it across; 50 Yr Old Ted just seems depressed. (And the years have not been kind to their voices. Ted’s gotten lower - and is now a rumbly Kris Kristofferson cro Bill’s is now a kind of high, nasally Art Garfunkel whine

T-T-T-THEY SAY THE HEAR OF ROCK’N ROLL IS STILL BEATIN’, AND FROM WHAT I’VE SEEN I BELIEVE ‘EM; NOW THE OLD BOY MAY BE BARELY BREATHIN’.. BUT THE HEART OF ROCK’N ROLL. (a sort of harmony) THE HEART OF ROCK’N ROLL IS STILL BEATIN’.
In the back, Bill and Ted enter, shocked.

No way.. They say it just loud enough that on stage, 50 Yr Old Bil hears them - and looks up.. Which makes 50 Yr Old Ted do same thing. Now, like deer in headlights: 50 Yr Old Bill and Ted freeze. If the audience were payin attention, they’d notice the two sets of Bills and Teds a standing motionless, staring at each other, but no one ca There’s an odd moment where they all stand, staring. Then 50 Year Old Bill and Ted turn and bolt through the back e Bill and Ted look at each other - and sprint across the r
50 Year Old Bill and Ted scramble in their dress shoes ac the parking lot and race toward the (now quite beaten up) with their guitars. A beat later -
Wait! Bill!
Ted!  31. They race to the van, where 50 Yr Old Bill and Ted are opening the doors.
Hey - us’s. Stop. Older Bill and Ted turn - busted. Instantly (and lamely) they try and cover.
Ohhh! Hello!
We totally forgot you guys were coming! How great to see you!
What are you talking about? You totally ran away from us!
Oh - that’s just because.. in the darkness, we thought you were groupies, which we have a lot of. Bill and Ted look around the deserted back parking lot.
Really?
Oh, yah - absolutely. 50 Year Old Ted nervously pulls a flask from his hip pock and takes a swig.
Look - dudes - we know exactly what you’re thinking: why are we playing here at open mic night at the Holiday Inn in San Dimas, when in fact, we are such huge rock stars with lots of groupies?
And here's the answer: Us being here is humorously ironic.
Do you believe us?
I remember not necessarily believing it when I you was standing there listening to I me.  32.
But this time you really can believe us. (pause) Do you believe us?
No.
Not at all. 50 Year Old Ted takes another (this time bigger) gulp fro his flask. As he wipes his mouth with his sleeve:
(vaguely belligerent) Well I feel sorry for you then.
Do you have the song?
Do we have the song? Do we have the song?
Yes. Do you?
Ted. Stop drinking for a minute and look me in the eye. Do you have the song? 50 Yr Old Ted almost looks Ted in the eye: at his eyebrow between his eyes.. But not in the eye.

No. In the eye. Look me in the eye, Ted, and tell me you have the song. Otherwise we're gonna leave right now. Do you have the song or do you not? (beat; shakes his head sadly) You totally don’t have the song, do you?
(finishing his entire flask) You know what? Screw you, me.
Whoa, whoa!/Easy, Ted -
No - not easy. (to Bill and Ted) YOU didn’t write the song. YOU’RE the ones who're responsible for all of this. And you know something else, pretty boy?  33.
Don’t call me that.
“Don’t call me that.” “Dude.” You drove the princesses away.
Whoa. Wait. What did you say? The princesses are gone?
Oh, don’t act so surprised. They basically told you they were gonna leave. Well, guess what? As soon as you got back from this stupid, failed mission - they were gone.
What?
How??
No idea. Alls we know is they left a note saying they took Will and Theo back to 1428 and they never came back - and now we've been alone for five years cause you drove our wives away.
Our wives have been gone for five years and you haven’t even tried to talk to them?

Oh - you did, alright - you just made it worse! They had their doubts about you, which you were totally missing, I might add.. and then you went back to Medieval England and confirmed every one of em!
There is no way we did that.
Yah well you’re gonna eat your words in about 45 seconds.
Not true. Ted - let’s go talk to our wives right now and set this straight.
Fine. I’m done with you two losers.  34. Ted lunges for himself. Grabs himself --
Why don’t you take some responsibility, you drunk!
Why don’t you go knit a blob?
Hey!
Blob-knitter!
You’re rude! Get your act together, Ted!
You get your act together, Ted! The two Bills grab the two Teds - who are inches from throttling each other - and pull them apart.
Ted - back away - he’s not worth it.
He’s right. Don’t let that punk get to you. 50 Year Old Ted backs down. Bill turns Ted around.
Let’s go clean up the mess those us’s made. As Older Bill and Ted open the van doors, Bill and Ted se BILL'S FATHER, in back, in a sleeping bag.
Hi boys. How was the gig? Bill stops - eyes wide. Turns to his older self.
You live with Dad in the van?
(takes Bill’s shoulder) Walk away, dude. Walk away. As Bill and Ted make their way across the lot:
If you don’t like it - go fix it!  35.
Yah! Go write the song yourself instead of trying to steal it from us!
Or do something-- cuz our lives suck and it’s your fault.
The guys approach - and get into - the booth.
Those older us’s were jerks.
I know. I can’t believe how much I hated my me.
I know. But we did learn something quite important from them. We gotta go back to England.

I got a bad feeling about this. Behind the rows of men all watching them as they pass, th see barbed wire.. And guard towers.. and guards, with gun They’re in a PRISON. With everyone focussed on one thing: Bill and Ted, walking through the foggy, dimly lit yard, toward..
who become more and more distinct as Bill and Ted approac Super: San Quentin, 20 years in the future

«+WELCOME..... WELCOME TO THE END. Then it ends. 65 Yr Old Bill and Ted look up with dead ey

Like I care. The wall of prisoners has circled them and the men are staring - waiting for what seems to have been promised th

Way, guy.

Ted - do not get drawn into this argument - we talked about this - Suddenly we hear a crackling and see a flash of light in sky. 65 Yr Old Bill looks at 65 Yr Old Ted with urgency. 65 YR OLD BILL (CONT’D) We gotta do this before that future guy shows up and --  Suddenly he freezes. As does 65 Yr Old Ted. And everyone else around them as.. Only Bill and Ted are able to move. Bad.

Have any of you men seen a phone booth circa USA approximately 1989? Phone booth.
(rolls down window) Dad - it’s 5000 years ago - there’s no version of that that they understand.
(to slavedriver, who is raising his scimitar) If you draw that weapon I will arrest you, sir.  65.
Dad - you can’t arrest this guy. This is like three thousand BC.
(ignoring Deacon) Sir - this is your last chance. The guy - uncomprehending - raises his scimitar. Logan shakes his head - grabs his taser - and -

Dad - this is a terrible idea As the slavedriver comes at Logan with his huge blade, Lo instantly shoots him in the bare chest with his taser. The guy shakes violently and crumples to the ground, wher lays there, twitching and writhing. The slaves are terrified. Another GUARD comes at Logan. Logan tases him too. But more and more guards are coming.
Great. Now what are you gonna do? Logan grabs his GUN and FIRES IT INTO THE AIR. Which causes immediate and widespread panic.
The slaves scatter - the ones who were pulling the giant boulder. The ones who were securing it. It starts to move
Deacon’s eyes widen.
Dad!
I’m not quite done here -
Logan turns -- sees the boulder dislodging and starting t roll. He turns quickly. And he dives back into --
Where Deacon steps on the gas.  66.
GO! Put it in reverse! But the tires spin in the sand and --
Gains speed and rolls off the huge wagon - all 25,000 pou of it toward --

Which can’t get any traction.. As just as it starts to mo backwards -- -- CRUUUUUUUUNCH -- the boulder utterly crushes the car. Pause. Silence. The slaves and slavedrivers all stop and look as we hold the huge motionless boulder in the dust.. and then we cut

WE HOLD for a while. As our eyes adjust we begin to sense that we are in some kind of a deep, deep cave. Gradually we begin to SEE some reflected blue and red lig from above... and we HEAR an approaching SIREN.. as.. THE POLICE CAR plummets into frame - dropping and droppin down this seemingly bottomless hole. CAMERA DROPS WITH IT- for a while.. We see Deacon and Log sitting in the front seat -- too gobsmacked to scream.
What just happened?
I think we were crushed by that giant boulder and killed. A pause. Logan looks around, nodding.
So where are we then?

My guess is we are falling to -- Suddenly there’s a loud WHOOOMPH as the car hits the grou and bounces a moment before stopping entirely.  67. As the dust clears around them we see red, fiery light playing off their faces as they look around and gape. And cut to:
We’re outside a REST HOME as - FLASH - the shimmering pho booth appears and lands. Bill and Ted get out, approach t front door. Super: San Dimas, California, 50 Years In the Future
Bill and Ted enter, turn and go down a hallway toward an door backlit with light. They cross and enter --

-- Where they step in and see.. in two beds, TWO VERY, VE OLD MEN-- 95 YEAR OLD BILL AND TED. Ancient, frail, in the final moments of their lives. They look up with grateful recognition as Bill and Ted enter.
(gently) How’s it goin’?
All I can say is we’re so glad you’re finally here.
And so happy to be able to share the song with you.
So then-- there is a song?
As it turns out, there is.
When was it written?
A long, long time ago. You just didn’t recognize it.
Is it.. good?  68.
It’s amazing. You can’t imagine how proud you'll feel when you play it.
When do we play it?
Tonight. The guys look at each other, amazed, excited. Then..
Is there.. a title? The ancient thems look at each other.. Then back at the g
It’s called..
..-Face the Music. The guys take this in. It’s clear it’s the truth. Exchanging a look, Bill and Ted separate.
(taking his older self’s hand) Bill.. I just want to say thank you for all the times you’ve been there for me..
I’m so sorry for the times I let you down, Bill.
(voice catching) You never did, Bill, you never did. At the same time, on the other side of the room:
I feel like I never really knew you, Ted.
I know, that’s my fault. I never truly opened myself up to you. The truth is-- I looked at you and saw myself.
I know, me too.
But now, as I reach the end, there’s so much that I want to say to you.  69. We hear crying and MOVE BACK TO THE BILLS. Bill is huggin his ancient, dying self, whose eyes are dimming.
Te adoro, Guillermo...
I‘ll never forget you, Bill. Ever. Bill looks over to Ted, who leans close to 95 Yr Old Ted.
There is one more thing we need to ask you.
I know. Elizabeth and Joanna. (a pause; voice catching) We haven't seen them since the day they left.
Oh no, please don’t say that.
But I’m afraid it’s true.
Does it have to be that way? 95 Yr Old Ted takes Ted’s hand.
Unless you two change it.
Can we?
Of course you can. None of this has to happen.
Believe us: When the song is played, everything will change.
But how are we gonna play it? We don’t even know what it is.
Its with you. It’s with you right now.
Where?  70. 95 Yr Old Ted starts to point - but his hand drops. He lo at ancient Bill. They both nod ever-so-slightly, then loo back at their younger selves and say:
Catch you later, Bill and Ted. And with that, they die. Bill and Ted stare for a long moment.. Then..

Dude-- In honor of our late selves, I propose that we get back to the Fabulous Forum and immediately play our song.. Ted nods. Meanwhile: IN HELL —- SAME The cop car cruises along, slowly, demons and anguished s peering in, crowding them, making it difficult to navigat Logan flicks the lights on top and BLIPS the siren a coup times. Then gets on the mic and says, amplified:
Please move away from the vehicle. I repeat: please move away from the vehicle immediately. No change. If anything, it’s getting more difficult to mo
Dad - that is lame. I mean, we’re in hell.
Now you’re telling me how to be a police officer. You gonna replace me there too?
Finally it comes out.
Finally what comes out, Deacon?
That this is about Missy.
I’m sorry - when you say “Missy” are you referring to your wife - or are you referring to my ex-wife? Oh - oh - I’m sorry - they’re the same person. (MORE )
(re tortured souls) You know what? Stop the car. I’m gonna deal with this. Logan pushes the door open and steps outside.
Logan stands about a head or two ABOVE the hunched-over TORMENTED SOULS as TWO FEARSOME DEMONS approach and growl
I need you to move these people out of the way, please. The Demons come toward him, eyes glowing.

I'm telling you to freeze right there, sir. Both of you. (as they keep coming) Consider yourselves warned. Now Logan removes his BEAN BAG GUN from his belt and FIRE THREE BEAN BAGS INTO THE FIRST DEMON’S CHEST, who falls o backward with a wail. The other demon keeps coming. Logan CLUBS HIM WITH HIS BILLY CLUB - then MACES HIM. As the De grabs his eyes, moaning, Logan reflexively cuffs him. Deacon exits, is now standing on the other side of the ca

Good work, dad. What are you gonna do about the rest of them? Logan turns, sees what Deacon's referring to: Two HUGE DEMONS are lumbering menacingly toward them.. Logan looks out, then looks down at his weapons..
Let’s get back in the car.
Good idea. They re-enter the car. Suddenly STARTLED as they see: Sitting in the back seat is DEATH, black-clad, white-face Very, very somber.
Who the hell are you?
I am “Death.” I knew your son and his friend Bill. We were band mates. 72. We sense in Death a kind of longing - he misses those eve brief good moments; the last (and only) ones of his life.
(very straight-faced) Man did I party hard. Too hard, it turned out. And the women. Whoo-boy. Yes, I was a player... He looks off, nostalgic.
Excuse me. (as Death turns back) Why are you here? Are you just here to reminisce? Because we actually need to find a way out of here.
Yes, I can help you. I’ve still got some ‘juice’ around here. This way. Death makes a gesture out the window and a slight path op As Deacon starts to drive:
So.. how is the band? Have the guys come up with the song yet?
No - and they never will. They're delusional.
Oh - you still think that?
I know. That’s what I’ve been saying.
Hey, you know what-?
(raising a hand) Excuse me. Gentlemen. Please. I get enough conflict down here. Can we just have some chill tunes?
You know, I think that’s a good idea.  73. Deacon turns on the CD player. JACK JOHNSON’S “BETTER TOGETHER” comes on.
Mnnn. Love me my Jack Johnson. He sits back, slightly moving to the beat as -- FROM A HIGH, WIDE SHOT: The police car cruises through he Jack Johnson music wafting up. HOLD a moment, then cut to

The MARQUEE reads “TONIGHT - WYLD STALLYNS presents ‘Two Decades of Triumphance!’"” There’s a FLASH in the sky, an moment later the booth lands and the guys jump out and ru towards the artists’ entrance. As they run..
I still don’t understand.. How are we gonna play the greatest song ever written when we don’t even know it?
Ted, you heard us: we have it with us. We've obviously been over-thinking this. We just have to let it happen.
So we’re just gonna make it up as we go along?
Exactly. Ted nods, not totally convinced, as the guys hurry toward EXT. ARTISTS’ ENTRANCE - CONTINUOUS The guys move quickly to Frank.

Gotta admit-- didn’t think you two’d actually show up. (into radio) They're here. Cut the house lights. Frank throws open a door marked “STAGE” and they push in in front of them, the arena dims. They look nervously at each other.
Our world is about to change, dude.  74. They mount the steps toward the side curtains which block
Which is lit. But the guys don’t see much of it - yet.
Ready, Ted?
Ready, Bill. And they stride past a curtain and onto..
Which is totally empty. No mics. No instruments. Nothing. They stand in the glare of the bright lights on the total bare stage. It’s too dark in the audience to see out.
Dude.. What’s going on?
I don’t know.. Maybe we gotta keep going.
Going... where?
To the mics.
There are no mics.
I think we just gotta start.
Okay. I guess.
Ready? One.. Two..
One - two - three - four! Silence. They stand there - look at each other. Nothing coming int their heads.
Let's try again.  75.
Okay. One - two - three - four. Still nothing. Beat. They walk closer to the center of the stage. It’s like a very, very bad dream.
Hello? It’s utterly silent in the audience.
Hello, Fabulous Forum? More silence. A beat. Ted turns to the side:
Um.. Could we have the house lights up? A beat later - a loud KA-CHUNK, and the guys stare out at
Which is completely empty. Not one ticket has been sold. Bored USHERS motionlessly man utterly empty tunnels. CONCESSION WORKERS stand idly behind their counters.
Bill and Ted just look around, confused, disoriented...

I don’t understand... DING DING DING, a warning light goes off on the timepiece TWO MINUTES LEFT. Suddenly the guys feel something strang Their feet are starting to move. They gape at each other terrified - as.. They begin sliding backwards - WHAM - into the phone boot Which lights up automatically and quickly SHOOTS DOWN thr the pavement and is gone. Revealing: ROLLINS, by his booth, watching. He steps back inside.. a WHOOSH.. It’s gone, too.  76.
Above, the sky starts to DARKEN ominously. LIGHTNING flashes.. Some cracks start to appear in the ground. We P

head_text.subj: THE 76 STATION ACROSS FROM THE FORUM

text: Where a guy gets out of his car to pump gas and stops sho totally baffled as he sees: An EQUALLY CONFUSED ROMAN SOLDIER - in toga, with lst cen weaponry - just standing there, under the fluorescent lig of the gas station. Both men stare at each other, utterly confounded. And we to:
Stark, white, quiet. As if we are up in the clouds. The POLICE CAR is parked. Deacon and Logan are standing, waiting. In silence. For a long while. Until, finally:

Fine. Ted wasn’t wrong. (off Deacon’s look) He was right. Ted was right. Ted was.. totally, one hundred percent right. About everything. You happy? Deacon nods. Footsteps. Death approaches, exiting a heavy gold door.
How'd it go?

My bad. I thought I could get the gate key. But the truth is, the old man just got pissed. That’s the bad news. The good news? I just got scored a new Play Station which is pretty rad, and since we'll be spending a lot of time - like “eternity” - together--
(interrupting) No. Absolutely not. I’m not staying here.
Well I’m afraid you don’t get to make the--  77.

No. No no no. My son is in serious jeopardy - and I have a job to do. He pushes past Death and through the gold door, which clo with a solid whoomph. Deacon and Death look at each other as, OFFSCREEN, we hea Logan's insistent, muffled voice - and a lower, booming, muffled voice - talking over each other. Death looks at Deacon, raises an eyebrow.
Wow. Your old man has a very big ball sack, bro. There's a brief beat of silence. Followed by a low PHHUP- PHHHHHUP, and then..
Which is then followed by a very heavy THUD. And groaning And then Logan storms out, eyes straight ahead - jaw fixe holding a GILDED SKELETON KEY.
Did you just bean-bag God, Dad?
Yes I did. Get in. Deacon turns - follows his father to the car.

I'll try to smooth this out. Say hi to the fellas for me. And - oh - one thing. Can I keep that chill Jack Johnson CD? Deacon hands Death the CD, the police car screams away.. shimmers and disappears and we cut to:
--BANG - the phone booth lands, roughly, followed a half later by the silver booth. The guys get out - shaken - and find themselves face to f with the THREE GREAT LEADERS, who are scowling, furious.
You have failed utterly.  78. Though inside the dome, we HEAR UTTER CHAOS coming from outside: thunder - the ground is quaking - screaming.. people in the dome are running.

Why we ever put our hopes in you two idiots is beyond me. And he and the others turn, stride off. There is a final BEEEEEEP on the timepiece as it runs out. The guys just stand, looking down at it-- horrified, speechless. Then Rollins steps between them. They look at him.
What’s going to happen? Rollins indicates for them to follow.
As Rollins leads them, shell-shocked, into the room which houses the TIMELINE.
This is the new reality. He points all the way down towards antiquity.

Whoa.. The time line appears to be fraying: bending upward, twisting back in on itself, contorting - like a hose out control or a downed electrical line. The guys move closer. Ted touches it. Suddenly an image pops up: The BUDDHA is running in panic from -- A CAVEMAN - who catches him and CLUBS HIM on the head..

Whoooaaaa.. Dude-- the Buddha just got clubbed by a caveman. Bill moves forward, touches the timeline. We see the Last Supper -- 12 people sitting in a torch-lit tent. Suddenly two OMINOUS SHADOWS appear on the tent wall and we HEAR a pair of loud SCREECHES as a_FEARSOME CLAW suddenly tears tent. The 12 disciples leap and run as -- Bill turns to Ted:  79.
Ted, if I’m not mistaken, I believe the Last Supper was just disrupted by a pair of velocirapters.
Oh, no.. They cross together.. Look at the line.
Dude. It’s like everything is just blending together.
It’s collapsing in on itself. Starting at the ends - and moving toward the middle.
It’s in 1400 now.. Does that mean it’s about to hit..? The guys look at each other, then look toward medieval ti the 1400's - suddenly grasping something -
You brought our families there.
That I did.
Why?
Ted --
Why would you do that?
Ted - it doesn’t matter now. We just gotta get there and get em back. Ted looks at Rollins - then follows Bill as..
Through the chaos and into the phone booth and we cut to:
The booth appears on TOP OF A CASTLE WALL and Bill and Te leap out, suddenly stopping and reacting in horror.  80.

Dude - look. WITHIN THE CASTLE, guarded by dozens and dozens of fearso looking KNIGHTS in armor who are brandishing swords-- Joanna, Elizabeth, Will, Theo - as well as the Duke and Duchess - are bound and are being led along SCAFFOLDING toward 6 NOOSES. The King stands nearby and shouts out over the chaos:

For bringing darkness into our world, this entire family must die! Bill and Ted look in the other direction: below them - OUTSIDE THE CASTLE - pounding on the gates and trying to down the castle walls - are: SOLDIERS FROM EVERY ERA - Trojan warriors, Incas, Nazis, Coats - you name it - all ramming the gates.. Scaling the walls.. pulling pins in grenades, etc. And more are comin from other directions.
Dude, what are we gonna do? There’s not just guards and executioners in the castle - but there’s like armies from all through history outside the castle.
I know. And we got like 30 seconds to figure it out and we’d need like 30 years!
But dude-- we don’t got 30 years to figure it out.
(a beat) We don’t.
What? What do you mean?
We don’t - cause we’re just starting to think about it now. But what if we start thinking about it thirty years ago?
How? We'd have to start when we’re like ten.  81.
Exactly!
(eyes widening) Whoa! Dude! That means, alls we gotta do is--
--go back and find ourselves when we're ten --

-- when we actually have 30 years to think about it.. and get ourselves thinking about it! (turns ) Ted - you have had many ingenious ideas which on the surface seem counterintuitive. But this is the counterintuitivest of them all. Let’s go, dude. They jump back into the phone booth, quickly dial. With a flash, the booth disappears and we cut to: INT. BILL’S CHILDHOOD HOUSE - NIGHT VAN HALEN’S “RUNNIN’ WITH THE DEVIL” plays on the tape de as 10 year old Bill and Ted jump on the beds, playing air guitar and singing along. Super: San Dimas, California, 1980 The door opens and 14 YEAR OLD MISSY sticks her head in.
You guys need to brush your teeth and get ready for bed. Your folks will be home soon, Bill.
Okay, Missy. She puts her Walkman headphones back on, exits.
Dude, your babysitter is cute.

I know, remember when we were in kindergarten and she was in third and we asked her to the pumpkin dance?  82. They hear LOUD RAPPING on the window. There, outside, in shadows, desperate and frenetic, are adult Bill and Ted.
Dudes! Let us in! Hurry!
Wh-who are you?
Don’t worry! We’re you, it’s fine! The boys - terrified - turn and try to run out - but Bill Ted open the window and rush in and catch them at the doo
Dudes, listen to us. We're you. We're what you will become.
Yah - and we’re here to prevent you from destroying time and space as we know it.
Not to mention destroying your marriages. And alienating your kids.
Elizabeth is gonna be the love of your life, Ted, and you’re gonna blow it. And Will and Theo will think you two are completely blind idiots, which you are.
You will be lonely beyond description without Joanna, Bill. Especially when mom walks out on you and never comes back.
But! Here’s the good news: It doesn’t have to happen.
Yah, alls you gotta do is take the next 30 years to figure out how to save your wives and sons and in-laws from being hanged in 1428! Simple, right?
But you gotta start now - like right now. The two boys are too stunned and scared to speak. Bill an Ted kneel down, get right in their own faces.  83.

So-- ARE you gonna spend the next 30 years figuring this out? Are you? Are you?? The two kids, looking like they’re about to cry, are so scared that they cannot even manage tiny little nods. Bil and Ted look at each other.
Dude, they’re not getting it. What do we do?

Bill and Ted shove their beyond-terrified, whimpering, trembling younger selves into the booth. As Ted dials.. A CAR screeches into Bill’s driveway and a woman (35, pre curly blonde hair) rushes towards them, yelling at the to her lungs--
Bill’s jaw drops in amazement as the booth sparks.. Bill and Little Bill both press their faces to the glass.
But the shimmering booth is now dropping-- And just before it disappears, Bill notices that --
Mrs. Preston has slipped and tumbled in and now --
Bill is horrified.
Oh, no! I always knew I was responsible for my mom’s leaving.
Dude, you weren't.  84.
Ted, I literally just was. Mom!
(voice disappearing) BILLLLLL1111111111...... Bill and Little Bill stare in horror and we cut to..

location: ON TOP OF THE CASTLE WALL, (1428)

text: The booth lands back on the parapet and.. Bill and Ted dr their 10 year old selves out of it.
Bill: stop crying. Even though Mom's gone, I love you and I will always be there for you.
Dude - you can’t promise that.
Okay - I won’t be there for you. But you are gonna have to be there for us.
Yah. You guys have to see this. Gradually the terrified 10 year olds open their eyes.

Now. Is this burned on your brain? The kids stare down at the confusion: royal guards on the inside - soldiers from all of time on the outside, climbi the walls, clambering to get in. Their younger selves give horrified nods.
Good. Now. Here’s what you need to do:
See those people down there? Those are your beloved wives and sons - and that’s their grandparents. They’re about to be hung by their necks till they’re dead.
You don’t want that to happen? Spend the next thirty years coming up with a plan to get us out of this.  85.
And do it fast. Cause we only got about thirty seconds and we don’t have any idea what to do.
Now get going. (swatting his young self on the ass) Get.
(shoving himself roughly)
n. As they shove the kids back into the booth and speed-dial numbers -- And BOOM.
Even though space-time is unravelling - because of you - it doesn’t matter. You have to save them.
So don’t blow it.
Don’t blow anything.

Do everything right, always. You two - alone - are responsible for saving everything. Okay? The booth is gone. Alerting the attention of TWO GUARDS WITH BOWS AND ARROWS, who turn, on the parapet, an start toward.. Bill and Ted - who quickly spot--
and hurry into it, mulling what just happened as they rus down it.
I don’t think that went particularly well.
Yah. I think in our desperation we came on a bit too strong.  86.
I know, midway through, I started to totally remember this whole thing from when it happened to us.
I know. I’d always thought that was just some weird nightmare.
Yah - the worst nightmare of all time.
Totally. So bad that I musta completely blocked it out.
But now that we’re talking about it - it’s like in the back of my mind, I’ve always been thinking about it.
I know.. Me, too.
Dude. Is it even possible that it worked?
What do you mean?
Well.. What if we now have been thinking about this - subconsciously - for thirty years?
I don’t know. Then I guess we’d know more about what to do.
Yah. Like.. I don’t know.. Ted reaches into his jacket packet and pulls out the LARG BLOB OF YARN.
Dude, you're gonna knit?

I don’t think so. I think I’m gonna just do.. This. Ted holds the yarn blob right in front of Bill - AND INSTANTLY - there’s a “THWOOK” - and A SPEEDING ARROW lod right in the blob - and not into Bill.  87.

Whoa! Suddenly Ted turns, shifts his arm, and - THWOOK-THWOOK - more arrows lodge into the blob. From the CASTLE GUARDS who'd just seen them on the parapet. They look at each other and now burst out a door and into

head_text.subj: A COURTYARD ON THE CASTLE GROUNDS

text: Where it’s chaos: soldiers and denizens from all of time drop down over the walls and swarm, doing battle with the royal guards. Bill and Ted make their way out.
Dude - you have been thinking about this! That must be why you’ve been making yarn blobs all these years!
Whoa! Yah! I wonder what you’ve been thinking about?

I don’t know. I look forward to finding out. Suddenly they both freeze as they HEAR LOUD VOICES IN ANC CHINESE and they turns slowly to see: 2 DOZEN HUNS stand before them, spears raised, with a LEA yelling in Mongolian.
Bill and Ted's eyes widen -
Whoa... Ted yanks a knitting needle, holds it “threateningly.” It does nothing. The Huns come closer. Suddenly -- AN OFFSCREEN VOICE YELLS LOUDLY IN ANCIENT MONGOLIAN.
The Huns look at the guys for a second.. And then move on pushing past.
Whoa.. I didn’t even see who said that.  88. Bill looks at TED with a little smile. And then, with his mouth completely closed, he says:
Me neither, dude!
Whoa! I’m not sure what’s more impressive: your ventriloquism, or your use of ancient Mongolian.
Thanks! And I spent that whole summer and only learned two phrases! I guess I won’t get to use the other one. (then, turning) Hing tak ga.
He steps aside as a Mongolian warrior moves past, almost hitting him. Gaining confidence now, they start moving again.
(pointing) Our families are just on the other side of that wall. Indeed - there’s a LARGE CASTLE WALL just on the other si of this courtyard.
How we gonna get through all this and over there? They see a HORSE-DRAWN CARRIAGE moving through the chaos.

Camp Weekhoko - summer of 83! They two of them race to the wagon and slide under - immediately get into “crab-walking” position (legs forwar hands behind, body facing up) and - using the carriage as “cover” -— they crab-walk exceedingly fast - scuttling fo under the carriage. They are very good at it. (And they know it.)
Dude - that whole summer - all the counselors were like “don’t you wanna do anything besides crab-walk?”
And we were like --  89.
Nope!
Now we know why. And they roll out - rise. Look at the wall - and then loo at TWO FELLED FLAG POLES which have just been knocked fro the walls.
Pole vault!

Good idea, dude! They each grab an end of one of the long flagpoles and tr plant the pole, but they both just end up running along t pole with it sliding through their hands until they both plant at the other end of the wood.
Dude.
I know. I just remembered: we never learned how to pole vault!
Then why did we think these poles were a good idea? The guys look at the long wooden sticks they are holding their hands.
Bill and Ted are STILT-WALKING - 25 feet in the air.
I’m not sure this was such a good idea either. We’re still not high enough to get over the wall.
I know. And I feel somewhat vulnerable and exposed. Below them HORDES OF SOLDIERS are approaching their long, spindly wooden “legs.”
Maybe we should wave to them like Uncle Sam.  90.
Dude - what does Uncle Sam say?
(alternating, while waving) Good day citizens! Happy Fourth of July! We are Uncle Sam! We want you.. To stop trying to knock us over!
Dude - we have to remember to not have this misguided stilt-walking plan. Below them SOLDIERS whack the stilts. The guys teeter.
Well there must be some reason we did it. They hear an o.s. SCREECH and suddenly see TWO HUGE, SCAL REPTILIAN CLAWED FEET rise up over the wall..
That’s why! They reach up and grab the legs. Now look up and see the UNDERBELLY of a huge scaly flying beast. Below - the shadow of a PTERODACTYL moves toward the wall the guys rise up..
Dude - I hate to even ask this question.. But how - and when - could we have learned how to ride pterodactyls?
I’m not sure we did, dude.

Oh, yah. They look at each other -- and then just fall to the grou with a double WHUMPF as we hear heavy wings flump away. EXT. CASTLE COURTYARD —- CONTINUOUS They look up. They are at the feet of the executioners -- just yards away from where their wives and children have their heads on blocks.
Joanna! Theo! Elizabeth! Will! Their families look up as Bill and Ted rise, full of confidence.  gl.
Stop, executioners.
Unhand our families. Now.
Bill?
Ted? Suddenly swords appear at their necks.
Apparently 30 years was not quite enough time.
Bill and Ted’s heads are placed in nooses next to the oth The guys look at their wives and sons.
Liz.. Will.. I’m sorry. We tried to save the world - but we failed.
(to Joanna and Theo) We tried to save you - and we failed that, too.
I love you both. The King nods - the hangmen start away from the scaffoldi
I must say - it’s darkly ironic that the name of the song we supposedly wrote is “Face the Music”..
(nods ) Cuz I think that’s what we’re about to do. There’s a beat. Will and Theo look at each other.
Wait - dad - what did you say the song was called?
Face the Music.  92. Now the women look at each other.. then at Bill and Ted.. grasping something. Below, the King gets in position for the execution.
Ted.
Bill.
What? The women nod to the boys, who are looking at their dads. And suddenly... it hits Bill and Ted like a tidal wave. T eyes widen. They look at their sons.

That's your song, isn’t it? Ted wriggles a hand free, manages to reach into his pocke and pull out the now-crumpled sheet of paper that he took from Will the night before. He unfolds it.. And opens it. It’s sheet music. Written o the top are the words “FACE THE MUSIC.”
I’ve had it in my pocket the whole time. Now, below, the King gives a signal. The executioners mov toward the lever - and begin to pull it..
That future guy was right, there is a song.
I just kinda wish we’d figured this out a bit sooner. They are all about to hang... when suddenly, from outside castle, we hear:
